[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: vesting_contracts] [Removal Logic] Is there proper handling when a vesting contract is removed from the vector, or can this leave duplicate or stale entries that break invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: vesting_contracts] [Ordering] Does the order of addresses in the vesting_contracts vector matter for any operations, and can reordering lead to unexpected behavior or vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: vesting_contracts] [Zero Address] Can the zero address (0x0) be added to vesting_contracts, and would this cause panics or undefined behavior in downstream operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: create_events] [Event Replay] Can an attacker replay create_events to make it appear that additional vesting contracts were created, confusing off-chain indexers and causing incorrect UI displays? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: create_events] [Event Ordering] If events are emitted out of order or with incorrect timestamps, can this cause confusion in vesting contract tracking and audit trails? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: create_events] [Event Handle Corruption] If the EventHandle becomes corrupted (e.g., invalid counter or GUID), can this prevent future vesting contract creation or event emission? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: create_events] [Event Spam] Can an attacker create excessive vesting contracts to spam create_events, overwhelming event indexers and causing off-chain systems to fail? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: create_events] [Missing Events] If event emission fails but the vesting contract is still created, can this cause discrepancies between on-chain state and off-chain tracking? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Atomic Updates] When both nonce and vesting_contracts are updated during contract creation, is this operation atomic, or can partial updates lead to inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Concurrent Access] Can concurrent transactions modifying the same VestingAdminStore cause race conditions that lead to lost updates or state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [State Divergence] Can different validators end up with different VestingAdminStore states due to non-deterministic operations, causing consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Merkle Proof] Does the VestingAdminStore participate in state commitment via Jellyfish Merkle tree, and can inconsistencies in this struct cause merkle proof verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [State Rollback] If a transaction creating a vesting contract is aborted after modifying VestingAdminStore, is the rollback guaranteed to be complete and correct? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Cross-Resource Consistency] If a vesting contract exists but is not in the admin's vesting_contracts vector (or vice versa), can this inconsistency be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Deterministic Hashing] Is the hash/commitment of VestingAdminStore deterministic across all nodes despite potential vector ordering or serialization differences? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Unauthorized Creation] Can an attacker create a VestingAdminStore resource at another user's address without permission, potentially hijacking their vesting contract management? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Unauthorized Modification] Can anyone other than the admin modify the vesting_contracts vector or nonce field to manipulate vesting contract tracking? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Unauthorized Read] Does reading VestingAdminStore leak sensitive information about the admin's vesting contracts that could be used for targeted attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Privilege Escalation] Can an attacker exploit deserialization or type confusion to gain admin privileges over a VestingAdminStore they don't own? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [System Address Protection] Can VestingAdminStore be created at system addresses (0x0, 0x1, etc.), and would this cause privilege escalation or bypass security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker exploit Rust's type system to cast VestingAdminStore to another type and bypass security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Use-After-Free] If VestingAdminStore is moved or dropped while still referenced elsewhere, can this cause use-after-free vulnerabilities? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Unsafe Code] Does any unsafe Rust code interact with VestingAdminStore that could bypass memory safety guarantees? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Field: vesting_contracts] [Vector Bounds] Can out-of-bounds access to the vesting_contracts vector cause memory safety violations or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/vesting.rs] [Struct: VestingAdminStore] [Clone Safety] Is VestingAdminStore Clone-safe, or can cloning create aliased mutable references that violate Rust's borrow checker? (Medium)
